messages: 878a85276c31411e2cb8d1ca4bf8c69e (19:22): hi, is there a place one can ask about WebSockets?
878a85276c31411e2cb8d1ca4bf8c69e (19:22): (as I read somewhere they weren't HTML5 anymore :/)
590325cab98d895113e22a5a703a0f10 (19:23): 878a85276c31411e2cb8d1ca4bf8c69e: This is the place for HTML5 & friends. That's a friend. :)
590325cab98d895113e22a5a703a0f10 (19:23): (though don't ask me)
878a85276c31411e2cb8d1ca4bf8c69e (19:23): 590325cab98d895113e22a5a703a0f10: ah, k, then perhaps here I can find some answers :)
878a85276c31411e2cb8d1ca4bf8c69e (19:24): I was wondering if anyone knew what the behaviour should be when a WebSocket is opened, and traffic had occurred, and the client suddenly refreshes
878a85276c31411e2cb8d1ca4bf8c69e (19:25): The client sends a GET HTTP..., and my server answers with the response
878a85276c31411e2cb8d1ca4bf8c69e (19:25): but the client shuts down the connection
878a85276c31411e2cb8d1ca4bf8c69e (19:26): (and initially it _does_ work, so the parsing of the key et al should be okay)
878a85276c31411e2cb8d1ca4bf8c69e (19:27): hmz; I g2g, later
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (19:45): ut oh, i recognize the guy in the video on this page http://blog.chromium.org/2011/02/chrome-developer-tools-back-to-basics.html

590325cab98d895113e22a5a703a0f10 (19:53): Paul likes to wear blue.
590325cab98d895113e22a5a703a0f10 (19:53): I mean the copy thing, I learned that.
590325cab98d895113e22a5a703a0f10 (19:54): And that I should start creating window.$0 variables to confuse devs.

3499506720030d0685d8b7cf3a9fcdff (20:38): hey guys, do you think it would make sense to push all of my DOM updates into requestAnimationFrame, as a performance enhancement for browsers that support it?
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (21:01): does ie7 need that document.CreatElement fix or is it just ie6?
f8de579a5fa77f904d0241dd64faff98 (21:03): yes it does
3e65db05e37f34bd21c82600a0356298 (21:03): i would like an url where i specify the server port and the path... but not the host.... like ":4242/mypath" or something... is that possible ?.
590325cab98d895113e22a5a703a0f10 (21:06): ie8 too btw, aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (21:07): oh really
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (21:07): umm.. so innerShiv is what fixes that right?
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (21:07): or does modernizer do that as well
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (21:09): aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d: html5shiv and modernizr fix that
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (21:09): innerShiv is for making new elements on the page, after page load
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (21:12): i see
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (21:13): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: what's the point of role="main" in the html5 team?
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (21:13): template**
f8de579a5fa77f904d0241dd64faff98 (21:13): screenreaders
f8de579a5fa77f904d0241dd64faff98 (21:14): aria enabled screenreaders detect what the main part of a document is with that aria attribute
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (21:14): oh
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (21:14): gotcha
